name: Zanzibar Coffee House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unless you ask a local to show you the way, you're likely to spend hours wandering around Stone Town looking for the hotel, until you've been there 3-4 days. However Stone Town has a great atmosphere, so this is no hardship
reviews.title: Nice place, good location, hard to find

reviews.text: The rooms are nicely put together with a dark-wood theme. There is WIFI, though it didn't work for me
reviews.title: A Charming Place - mid range hotel. Solo Traveller issues.

reviews.text: I stayed here because of recommendations on Trip advisor. I agree with the majority of the reviews. This is a great place to stay. After 17 days of tenting and backpacking (Mt. Kilimanjaro and Safari) I treated myself and stayed in the Cappuccino Suite - (Awesome) but it was pricey ($135). Would recommend this suite for couples. I then switched to a single (it cost me $90) - the less expensive rooms were taken.
reviews.title: stylish boutique hotel in the middle of the old town with poor bathrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms I stayed in - had ceiling fans and A/C and mosquito nets.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Stone Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has backup generator - which is a good thing because the last 3 days that I was in Zanzibar - Stone town lost power and had to rely on the generators. When I flew out the power still had not been restored.
reviews.title: Good midrange hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a totally charming centrally located hotel, with great air conditioning. The roof terrace, where breakfast is served, has lovely views. The breakfast itself, and the famous coffee, were wonderful. We were on a budget so we booked a room with a shared bathroom. It really was a great deal. The bathroom was impeccably clean, and the coffee soap was surprisingly luxurious. The food in the restaurant downstairs is pretty special: the samosas and the gazpacho were memorably delicious.
reviews.title: Magical Historical Oasis of Calm and Beauty
Fun and cranky..
reviews.text: We stayed in the Arabica suite for one night in the middle of our honeymoon.. We really liked the hotel, full of character, lovely clean rooms with air con and amazing breakfast the next morning. the coffee is fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The down side is the location - although not far from the action you have to go through lots of little alleyways and at night we felt a quite nervous walking back and i would probably stay somewhere a bit more central if i was to go back.
reviews.title: Lovely Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night on our return to Stone Town so we already knew our way around and where it was - in Stone Town this is part of the fun - finding places and getting lost!
reviews.title: Great spot in the middle of the windy streets of Stone Town

reviews.text: The Dutch owner was extremely nice but the other staff were 'ok', they didn't go out of their way to be friendly like a lot of the other locals we met.
reviews.title: Tucked away gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night in late January to spend time exploring Stone Town.
reviews.title: Stylish Town Centre Hotel, Smells Great!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a pretty stylish affair, slightly rustic, great furniture and a fabulous rooftop terrace. It's an old Zanzibar merchant house converted to a cafe and hotel so all the rooms are highly individual and interesting. The air conditioning was good and much needed in this hot and humid town
reviews.title: quirky but pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great for wandering around and getting totally lost in the narrow bazaar streets. The rooftop terrace was also a interesting way to watch the dusk settle with all the comings and goings of a capital, muezzin calls competing for the attention of worshippers.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

aka: Zanzibar Coffee House Hotel Stone Town
